class greater&lt;void&gt;;

{{c/core|std::greater&lt;void&gt;}} is a specialization of {{lc|std::greater}} with parameter and return type deduced.

===Nested types===
{{dsc begin}}
{{dsc hitem|Nested type|Definition}}
{{dsc|{{tt|is_transparent}}|[[cpp/utility/functional#Transparent function objects|unspecified]]}}
{{dsc end}}

===Member functions===
{{dsc begin}}
{{dsc mem fun|cpp/utility/functional/greater_void|title=operator()|inlinemem=true|tests if {{c|lhs}} compares greater than {{c|rhs}}}}
{{dsc end}}

{{member|{{small|std::greater&lt;void&gt;::}}operator()|2=
{{ddcl|1=
template&lt; class T, class U &gt;
constexpr auto operator()( T&amp;&amp; lhs, U&amp;&amp; rhs ) const
    -&gt; decltype(std::forward&lt;T&gt;(lhs) &gt; std::forward&lt;U&gt;(rhs));
}}

Returns the result of {{c|std::forward&lt;T&gt;(lhs) &gt; std::forward&lt;U&gt;(rhs)}}.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|lhs, rhs|values to compare}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
{{c|std::forward&lt;T&gt;(lhs) &gt; std::forward&lt;U&gt;(rhs)}}.

If a built-in operator comparing pointers is called, the result is consistent with the [[cpp/language/operator comparison#Pointer total order|implementation-defined strict total order over pointers]].

{{cpp/impldef exception}}
}}

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;algorithm&gt;
#include &lt;cstdint&gt;
#include &lt;functional&gt;

constexpr bool strictly_positive(int lhs)
{
    return std::greater&lt;&gt;()(lhs, 0);
}

int main()
{
    constexpr std::int64_t low = 0B11;
    constexpr std::uint16_t high = 0X11;
    std::greater&lt;&gt; greater{};
    static_assert(greater(high, low));

    constexpr static auto arr = {0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5};
    static_assert(!std::all_of(arr.begin(), arr.end(), strictly_positive));
    static_assert(std::all_of(arr.begin() + 1, arr.end(), strictly_positive));
}
}}
